Books.Title: The Little Match-Seller
Books.Description: Read along version of classic Andersen's fairly tale with illustrations and narration. Read and listen in the same time. It was terribly cold and nearly dark on the last evening of the old year, and the snow was falling fast. In the cold and the darkness, a poor little girl, with bare head and naked feet, roamed through the streets.

Books.Title: The Ugly Duckling
Books.Description: Read along version of classic Andersen's fairly tale with illustrations and narration. Read and listen in the same time. It was lovely summer weather in the country, and the golden corn, the green oats, and the haystacks piled up in the meadows looked beautiful. The duck's eggs hatched: but the last hatchling, isn't like the rest...

Books.Title: Thumbelina
Books.Description: Read along version of classic Andersen's fairly tale with illustrations and narration. Read and listen in the same time. There once was a woman who wanted so very much to have a tiny little child, but she did not know where to find one. So she went to an old witch, and she said: I have set my heart upon having a tiny little child. Please could you tell me where I can find one?

Books.Title: Dziewczynka z zapałkami
Books.Description: Klasyczna baśń Andersena w wersji czytaj i słuchaj, z ilustracjami i narracją. Ciemna, zimna, grudniowa noc, szara posępna ulica a na niej stoi mała dziewczynka z pudełkiem zapałek…

Books.Title: Brzydkie kaczątko
Books.Description: Klasyczna baśń Andersena z ilustracjami i narracją. Czytaj i słuchaj jednocześnie. W pewnej kaczej rodzinie przyszły na świat małe, śliczne pisklęta. Wszystkie urocze, z wyjątkiem jednego ...

Books.Title: Calineczka
Books.Description: Klasyczna baśń Andersena w wersji  z ilustracjami i narracją. Czytaj i słuchaj jednocześnie. Pewna dobra kobieta bardzo pragnęła mieć maleńkie dziecko, ale nie wiedziała, skąd by je wziąć. Poszła więc do czarownicy i rzekła: — Tak bym chciała mieć malutkie dziecko. Powiedz mi, co tu robić, żebym je miała?

Books.Title: The Snow Queen
Books.Authors: Hans Christian Andersen, Kate Friend, Mateya Arkova
Books.Description:
Read Aloud version of beloved classic fairy tale. Retold and beautifully illustrated.  Read and listen in the same time. 
Two playmates live happily in a village until one of them is struck with a shard of glass from a mirror made by an evil fairy. The boy’s heart turns cruel and sad, and he is taken away by the Snow Queen to be her vassal. The girl must go on an epic journey to rescue him from the Snow Queen and bring him back to the family and friends who love him. Will she rescue her playmate, or will they both fall into the power of the Snow Queen and live in the frozen ice forever? This beautiful tale of love and friendship comes to life with charming illustrations to delight readers of all ages.

Books.Title: The Tortoise and the Hare
Books.Description: This classic fable tells the story of what happens when we try to rush and don’t take things slow and steady. The turtle and the hare decide to race. The hare is convinced that he is going to win because he can run so much faster than the turtle. But the hare is too confident in his speed and goes off the path, thinking he has plenty of time still to finish the race. Will the hare make up for the time he lost, or will the turtle prove that “slow and steady wins the race?” This beautifully illustrated fable from Aesop comes down through the centuries to teach us an important lesson about steadiness.

Books.Title: Puss in Boots
Books.Authors: Charles Perrault, Kate Friend, Mateya Arkova
Books.Description:
Read Aloud version of beloved classic fairy tale. Retold and bountifully illustrated.  Read and listen in the same time.
		Sometimes appearances really are the most important thing. A clever cat helps his poor master gain riches and fame just by making the right impression. He gives gifts to the king, pretends to live in a fine palace, and even defeats a cruel ogre all to convince the king that he is a rich and important person. But will the disguise catch up with him, or will he get away with it and live happily ever after? This charmingly illustrated folk story teaches an important lesson about how all people are the same deep down.

Books.Title: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs
Books.Description: Beauty can be a curse when you have a jealous queen after you. Snow White’s wicked stepmother wants to be the most beautiful in the land, and she plots to have Snow White killed. Snow White’s sweetness wins over her assassin, though, and she escapes to a cottage where seven little dwarfs live. The dwarfs welcome her in, but the evil queen still wants Snow White dead. Now, with the queen seeking her life, Snow White will learn the meaning of true love. This beautiful adaptation of the beloved fairy tale will win the hearts of old and young alike.

Books.Title: Rumpelstiltskin
Books.Description: This classic fairy tale is a cautionary story about making promises you don’t want to keep. A miller’s daughter must spin straw into gold for the king. She despairs, but an ugly little man appears who makes a deal with her. He will spin the straw into gold for her, for a price. A year later, the miller’s daughter is now the queen, and the little man returns for his price: her firstborn child. Will the queen guess the man’s name and win her daughter back, or will she have to pay a terrible price for the straw spun into gold? This charming fairy tale is beautifully illustrated to delight the young at heart of all ages.

Books.Title: Ali Baba and the Forty Thieves
Books.Description: A poor woodcutter finds a thieves’ lair full of unimaginable riches. But when his brother carelessly lets himself be caught by the thieves, a lethal struggle begins. If Ali Baba wins, he will be the richest man in the world. But if he loses, he will lose everything, even his life. This story of cunning and survival will have you on the edge of your seat!

Books.Title: The Voyages of Sinbad the Sailor
Books.Description: Sinbad is a sailor who travels to the ends of the earth to trade rare goods. His exploits take him to wild and dangerous places, where he walks on the back of a whale, gathers diamonds in the shadow of birds as big as dragons, defeats a vicious Cyclops, is buried alive, is captured by the Old Man of the Sea, sails on a river underground, and goes on an epic elephant hunt. His exciting adventures will spark your imagination and take you to places you have never dreamed of.

Books.Title: Mowgli's Brothers
Books.Description: Mowgli's Brothers is the story of the orphaned boy, Mowgli, who is adopted by a pack of wolves and must learn how to live in the jungle with the pack. The tale is rich in self-exploration and the search for personal identity.

Books.Title: The Adventures of Tom Sawyer
Books.Description: One of America's best-loved tales, Tom Sawyer is the story of a young boy's transition into a young man. Read and listen about exciting adventures of a typical boy during the mid-nineteenth century, adventures that are still intriguing and delightful because they appeal to the basic instincts of nearly all young people, regardless of time or culture.
